channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Dog mess on Clifden Road, 11th November
item.description:
Every day there are multiple occurrences of dog fouling on Clifden Road, south side, between Chatsworth and Glenarm Road. This was this morning at 9.15am.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Clifden Road, Hackney, London

item.title: Illegally parked abandoned car, 11th November
item.description:
This car has been illegally parking/abandoned on this spot since 22nd September without movement. This is a private land and the law states that the local authority must give 15 days notice to propose to remove the vehicle. It’s been more than a month since the last report on this car on this site and almost 2 months since the car is parked without movement. The car needs to be towed away

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Hubbard Street, Greenwich
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Flytipped paint and plasterboard, 11th November
item.description:
Plasterboard has been dumped and paint has been poured over it, sticking it to the ground. Cars have then driven through it leaving paint marks all over the road. It's been there a week or so.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 73, Braxfield Road, Brockley, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Sign and safety fences left behind, 11th November
item.description:
The work on the path was completed some time ago. And the repairs are were no longer shown on Fixed my Street. However, sign and safety fences have not been collected.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 151, Wickham Way, Park Langley, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Food and hazardous waste dumping, 11th November
item.description:
I’m reporting repeated incidents of illegal commercial waste dumping by food trucks operating at 103 Union Street, London SE1 0LA, managed by Samsite Ltd (one of the 9 vendors operating out of the site is dumping here). They have been regularly discarding meat waste, used oil cans, and other rubbish into the residential bins outside my property. We have had more rats, oil spills and rotten food smell from the waste that they are putting in the residential bins. This has caused overflowing bins, strong smells, and hygiene issues. As per the Environmental Protection Act 1990, commercial waste must not be disposed of in domestic bins, and this activity amounts to fly-tipping. I took these pictures this evening of these bins overflowing with mostly oil cans this time. I have previous pictures of the guys dumping rotten food, and hazardous waste from the food into the bins (including videos of where they are coming out of).

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Southwark Bridge Road, The Borough, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Road markings are very faded, 11th November
item.description:
Can the road markings please be repainted as cars frequently continue from lane 2 on Mildred road onto lane to on Westhorne avenue, when they should be proceeding into lane 3 of Westhone ave according to the faded lines. I typically approach from lane 1 of Mildred and drive toward lane 2 of Westhone as per the markings, however am frequently cut up by those is lane 2. In addition to repainting the lines signage would also be very useful. Perhaps a traffic survey would be worth it to monitor the lane usage.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Westhorne Avenue, Hither Green, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pedestrian crossing hazard, 11th November
item.description:
Temporary lights for pedestrians stuck on red since last week, causing public to put themselves at risk. People are having to guess when to cross this extremely busy road between Russell Square tube station and UCL/ British Museum etc. I do not know when it first started but certainly since last Wednesday. Have already witnessed some near misses. Worried there will be a casualty.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1-8, Russell Square, Bloomsbury, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Highly dangerous pedestrian crossing, 11th November
item.description:
The pedestrian traffic light from the square towards the tube station has been stuck on red since last week at this busy crossing point. People are risking their lives trying to cross the road. I thought it would be fixed by now, it's been like this for nearly a week now.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 9, Russell Square, Bloomsbury, London
Report on FixMyStreet
